title: Definition of direct joint variation
text: In a direct relationship, variables are directly proportional. This means that as $$x$$ or $$z$$ increases, $$y$$ increases, and vice versa.

title: Definition of inverse variation
text: In an inverse relationship, variables are inversely proportional. This means that as w increases, $$y$$ decreases, and vice versa.

title: General form
text: If "y varies jointly as the square of $$x$$ and the square root of $$z$$ and inversely as the cube of w" then the general form of our relationship will be $$y=\frac{{kx}^2 \sqrt{x}}{w^3}$$.

title: Solving for k.
text: Substitute $$x=3$$, $$z=4$$, $$w=3$$, and $$y=6$$ into our relationship $$y$$ $$=$$ $$\frac{k\left(x^2\right) \sqrt{z}}{w^3}$$ to solve for k. What do you get?

title: Put it all together
text: Now all you have to do is substitute k into the general form to get your equation!
